subject: Run same test method with different data
msgSnippet: ... Found that. It uses an inner class. Works great for some a test case I have. Seems like you could go another level and put another static inner class
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 19, 2004 12:54 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Run same test method with different data
...
> Jacqueline Guerrero wrote:
> > Is there a way to run a testXXX() method with the same set-up and
> > tear-down but with different data?
>
> You appear to want to create a Parameterized Test Case. Search the
> archives of this group for more information. ...

Found that. It uses an inner class. Works great for some a test case I have.

Seems like you could go another level and put another static inner class
inside each static inner class that you already had. Seems like this woud
work well for testing databases (select db, configure hibernate, sessions,
etc.). Has anyone fooled around with this?

Thanks
